apps.chess

Class AuxWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • apps.chess.AuxWriter

  • public class AuxWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    persists everything - distance matrix, player repertoirs, games data... OR loads everything :D the argument to the methods is a Directory, all the file names are given (and expected) automatically - BUT there are also methods that accept the name of the file directly also, to save, one gives the distance matrix, which has a link to a PlayersCollection, which has a link to GamesMetaDataCollection

        public static void writePlayersCollectionToDirectory(PlayersCollection pc,
                                     java.io.File f,
                                     boolean writeGamesMetaData)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        pc - players collection
        f - target directory - data will be persisted to the file "players.txt"
        writeGamesMetaData - whether to write the context meta data collection as well or not - if yes, it will be written to the same directory as gamesMeta.arff
